take any of the 3 marked exits.

The easiest N3 exit into Howick is the "Tweedie/Howick" exit - the furthest one from Durban, first one from further inland - as the road in has no "speed bumps". The other two exits lead into Howick over several of these which could be detrimental to low-slung cars!

content=700 hectares situated in the valley immediately below the Howick falls with eland, giraffe, impala, nyala, oribi, reedbuck, wildebees and zebra.
directions=opposite side of the N3 highway about 7km from Howick
content=Excellent watersport, fishing, camping and a game reserve.
hours=Open 8AM to 4:30PM daily for day visitors

content=Many antelope species including blesbok, reedbuck, hartebees, wildebees and zebra. Also some white rhino.

content=A 150 year-old stone house with original yellowwood ceilings and doors offers accommodation to travellers from all over the world.

content=Central to the Midlands Meander, the 40-hectare farm is a-top a hill, surrounded by pine and gum plantations, as well as natural forests, with sweeping 180-degree views of the Karkloof mountains. Homemade biscuits, chocolates and fresh flowers add a special touch in each room. Family run business.
